intro: Canarium occidentale, commonly known as the West African canarium, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, leathery leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing a single seed. Its latex, known as copal, is used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Canarium occidentale plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
